item.title: How AI-Driven Security Analytics Speeds Up Enterprise Defense
item.description: Fresh off a $250 million Series E round, Devo Technology plans to expand the core security analytics platform with new features to help enterprise defenders work with security data faster and more effectively.
item.dc:creator: Fahmida Y. Rashid, Features Editor, Dark Reading

item.title: CISA and Partners Coordinate on Security, Combatting Misinformation for Election Day
item.description: CISA will host an election situational awareness room to coordinate with federal partners, state and local election officials, private sector election partners, and political organizations to share real-time information and provide support as needed.

item.title: Zscalerâ€™s 2021 Encrypted Attacks Report Reveals 314% Spike in HTTPS Threats
item.description: Massive increase in cyberattacks targeting technology and retail industries confirms immediate need for zero-trust security

item.title: New 'Trojan Source' Method Lets Attackers Hide Vulns in Source Code
item.description: Researchers discover a new technique attackers could use to encode vulnerabilities into software while evading detection.
item.dc:creator: Dark Reading Staff, Dark Reading

item.title: CrowdStrike to Buy Zero-Trust SaaS Provider
item.description: SecureCircle provides data-level zero-trust control to endpoints.
item.dc:creator: Dark Reading Staff, Dark Reading

item.title: SonicWall: 'The Year of Ransomware' Continues with Unprecedented Late-Summer Surge
item.description: 2021 will be the most costly and dangerous year on record.

item.title: Free Tool Scans Web Servers for Vulnerability to HTTP Header-Smuggling Attacks
item.description: A researcher will release an open source tool at Black Hat Europe next week that roots out server weaknesses to a sneaky type of attack.
item.dc:creator: Kelly Jackson Higgins, Executive Editor

item.title: Name That Edge Toon: Parting Thoughts
item.description: Feeling creative? Come up with a clever caption, and our panel of experts will reward the winner with a $25 Amazon gift card.
item.dc:creator: John Klossner, Cartoonist

item.title: Understanding the Human Communications Attack Surface
item.description: Companies should recognize that collaboration platforms aren't isolated, secure channels where traditional threats don't exist.
item.dc:creator: Otavio Freire, CTO & President, SafeGuard Cyber

item.title: Enterprises Allocating More IT Dollars on Cybersecurity
item.description: Enterprises are allocating more IT dollars toward implementing a multilayered approach to securing data and applications against new threats, data shows.
item.dc:creator: Dark Reading Staff, Dark Reading

item.title: Snyk Agrees to Acquire CloudSkiff, Creators of driftctl
item.description: New capabilities allow Snyk Infrastructure as Code customers to more effectively detect infrastructure drift.

item.title: APTs, Teleworking, and Advanced VPN Exploits: The Perfect Storm
item.description: A Mandiant researcher shares the details of an investigation into the misuse of Pulse Secure VPN devices by suspected state-sponsored threat actors.
item.dc:creator: Kelly Sheridan, Senior Editor

item.title: Russian National Accused of Role in Trickbot Is Extradited to US
item.description: Court documents say Vladimir Dunaev is alleged to have been a malware developer for the Trickbot Group.
item.dc:creator: Dark Reading Staff, Dark Reading

item.title: Cybercriminals Take Aim at Connected Car Infrastructure
item.description: While car makers are paying more attention to cybersecurity, the evolution of automobiles into "software platforms on wheels" and the quick adoption of new features has put connected cars in the crosshairs.
item.dc:creator: Robert Lemos, Contributing Writer

item.title: What Exactly Is Secure Access Service Edge (SASE)?
item.description: Any company that supports a hybrid workforce should at least be familiar with this relatively new security approach.
item.dc:creator: Shaila Shankar, SVP and General Manager, Cisco Cloud Network and Security

item.title: A Treehouse of Security Horrors
item.description: True-life horrors from conversations with software engineers and developers. D'oh!
item.dc:creator: Adam Caudill, Principal Security Engineer at 1Password

item.title: Finding the Right Approach to Cloud Security Posture Management (CSPM)
item.description: Cloud security is maturing â€” it has to. New strategies are surfacing to respond to new problems. Dr. Mike Lloyd, RedSeal's CTO, reviews one of the latest: CSPM.

item.title: 6 Ways to Rewrite the Impossible Job Description
item.description: It's hard enough to fill a cybersecurity position given the talent shortage. But you may be making it harder with a poor job description that turns off would-be candidates.
item.dc:creator: Pam Baker, Contributing Writer

item.title: SEO Poisoning Used to Distribute Ransomware
item.description: This tactic â€” used to distribute REvil ransomware and the SolarMarker backdoor â€” is part of a broader increase in such attacks in recent months, researchers say.
item.dc:creator: Jai Vijayan, Contributing Writer

item.title: Top Hardware Weaknesses List Debuts
item.description: CWE list aimed at designers and programmers to avoid key hardware weaknesses early in product development.

item.title: ICS Security Firm Dragos Reaches $1.7B Valuation in Latest Funding Round
item.description: The $200M Series D represents the company's largest funding round to date.
item.dc:creator: Kelly Jackson Higgins, Executive Editor

item.title: Ordr Unveils Cybersecurity Innovations and Ransom-Aware Rapid Assessment Service to Expand Its Leadership In Connected Device Security
item.description: Enhanced ransomware detection, visualization of ransomware communications, and risk customization helps organizations respond to cyberattacks in minutes.

item.title: NSA-CISA Series on Securing 5G Cloud Infrastructures
item.description: CISA encourages 5G providers, integrators, and network operators to review the guidance and consider the recommendations.

item.title: Tech Companies Create Security Baseline for Enterprise Software
item.description: The Minimum Viable Secure Product is written as a checklist of minimum-security requirements for business-to-business software.

item.title: US to Create Diplomatic Bureau to Lead Cybersecurity Policy
item.description: As part of its modernization initiative, the Department of State will increase its IT budget by 50% and add a new bureau to lead cybersecurity and digital policy.

item.title: Stop Zero-Day Ransomware Cold With AI
item.description: AI can help recognize ransomware attacks and stop them at computer speed.

item.title: 3 Security Lessons Learned From the Kaseya Ransomware Attack
item.description: Organizations can better prepare themselves and their customers for these attacks with some strategies to identify threats before they become a widespread issue.
item.dc:creator: Ashok Sankar, VP of Solutions Marketing, ReliaQuest

item.title: You've Just Been Ransomed ... Now What?
item.description: Six crucial steps executives and IT teams should be prepared to take immediately after a ransomware attack.

item.description: The acquisition strengthens HelpSystemsâ€™ data security portfolio with data loss prevention capabilities across the endpoint, network, and cloud.

item.title: Defenders Worry Orgs Are More Vulnerable Than Last Year
item.description: Most IT and security leaders are confident their cybersecurity strategies are on the right track, but they still believe their organizations are as vulnerable as they were a year ago.

item.title: QR Codes Help Attackers Sneak Emails Past Security Controls
item.description: A recently discovered campaign shows how attackers are constantly developing new techniques to deceive phishing victims.

item.title: Read Between the Lines: Finding Flaws in EPUB Reading Systems
item.description: Security researchers who analyzed 97 free EPUB reading applications found half are not compliant with security recommendations.

item.description: Brain4Net builds tools to help enterprises and service providers add SD-WAN and NFV technologies to their existing infrastructure.

item.title: Cybercriminals Ramp Up Attacks on Web APIs

item.description: How identity and access management strategies held up during the pandemic and tips for putting together an identity security road map.

item.title: Annual Cyber Risk Survey Finds Businesses Are Sharpening Their Focus on Cybersecurity but Also Reveals Much Room for Improvement in Building Cyber-Resilience
item.description: This year's survey features the highest percentage of cyber insurance buyers since the beginning of the survey 11 years ago.

item.title: Cyber Readiness Institute Names Karen S. Evans as New Managing Director
item.description: Former assistant secretary for cybersecurity, energy security, and emergency response at US Department of Energy and Homeland Security CIO to lead strategic vision and day-to-day operations.

item.title: Cynerio Launches IoT Attack Detection and Response Module for Healthcare IoT Devices
item.description: Module helps hospitals identify, contain, and mitigate threats on devices exhibiting malicious or suspicious behavior.

item.description: Technology will be incorporated into Onfidoâ€™s Real Identity Platform.

item.title: Avast Business Introduces Network Discovery for SMBs
item.description: Avast's Network Discovery enables network administrators to easily analyze their entire IT network and deploy Avast Business security services.

item.description: Combination avails Secret Server customers to a range of SaaS services.

item.description: State-backed group is among a growing number of threat actors looking at supply chain companies as an entry point into enterprise networks.

item.title: Ready to Play? Squid Game Becomes an Attractive Lure to Spread Cyberthreats
item.description: Following demand from viewers, cybercriminals are not shy in taking advantage of fansâ€™ eagerness to watch the show, with well-known fraud schemes hitting the web.

item.title: IBM Announces Advances and New Collaborations in AI-Powered Automation, 5G Connectivity and Security at Mobile World Congress Los Angeles
item.description: IBM collaborates with Boston Dynamics, Cisco, Palo Alto Networks and Turnium Technology Group to help equip businesses in next phase of digital transformation.

item.title: CISA Announces Appointment of Washington Secretary of State Kim Wyman as Senior Election Security Lead
item.description: As an expert on elections, her appointment speaks to the Agencyâ€™s dedication to working with election officials throughout the nation in a non-partisan manner to ensure the security and resilience of our election infrastructure.

item.title: Gas Stations in Iran Downed by Cyberattack
item.description: Unknown attackers hijacked gasoline pump machines and defaced them with a message that reportedly included a phone number for Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei's office.
item.dc:creator: Dark Reading Staff, Dark Reading

item.title: Cybersecurity Talent Gap Narrows as Workforce Grows
item.description: Job satisfaction and salaries have both increased for cybersecurity professionals, as younger workers seek specific training to prepare for a cybersecurity career.

item.title: DoJ & Europol Arrest 150 in Disruption of DarkNet Drug Operation
item.description: Operation Dark HunTor targeted opioid traffickers on the DarkNet, leading to the seizure of weapons, drugs, and $31 million.
item.dc:creator: Dark Reading Staff, Dark Reading

item.title: Are Baby Boomers More Vulnerable Online Than Younger Generations? You Might Be Surprised
item.description: Growing up with computers and the Internet doesn't necessarily convey all the advantages often attributed to younger users.

item.title: Pulling Back the Curtain on Bug Bounties
item.description: It's critical that infosec professionals and consumers understand threats and vulnerabilities, but they are being kept in the dark.

item.title: Wardrivers Can Still Easily Crack 70% of Wi-Fi Passwords
item.description: Weaknesses in the current Wi-Fi standard and poorly chosen passwords allowed one wardriver to recover 70% of wireless network passwords.

item.title: OpenText Strengthens Ransomware Resilience
item.description: New detection and alert functions within Carbonite Server increase data protection against ransomware.

item.title: Forcepoint Completes Acquisition of Bitglass
item.description: The acquisition of Bitglass will be the third technology acquisition for Forcepoint this year.

item.title: Jumio Launches End-to-end Orchestration for its KYX Platform
item.description: Platform combines digital identity proofing, compliance verification and anti-money laundering checks.

item.description: Microsoft says the group has attacked more than 140 service providers and compromised 14 of them between May and October of this year.

item.title: Industrial Goods & Services Tops Ransomware Targets in 2021
item.description: While the industrial goods and services sector saw a decline in attacks during the third quarter, it remains the most targeted sector for ransomware this year.
item.dc:creator: Dark Reading Staff, Dark Reading

item.title: Who's In Your Wallet? Exploring Mobile Wallet Security
item.description: Security flaws in contactless payments for transportation systems could lead to fraud for stolen devices, researchers find.

item.title: 5 Ways CMMC Security Requirements May Impact Universities
item.description: The Cybersecurity Maturity Model Certification puts research universities in a position where they must validate the effectiveness of their security controls before applying for a grant or bidding on a government contract.

item.title: How We Can Narrow the Talent Shortage in Cybersecurity
item.description: Filling crucial roles in cybersecurity and addressing the talent shortage requires rethinking who qualifies as a "cybersecurity professional" and rewriting traditional job descriptions.

item.description: Software supply chain security experts to drive aggressive go-to-market strategy

item.description: Conventional data security tools do not address insider risk â€” a growing problem in today's remote-hybrid world. We need a better way to manage insider risk.

item.description: The launch of Android 12 brings several new default security features, along with new security efforts for Android Enterprise.

item.description: Online cybersecurity professional development platform bolsters the Check Point Education Initiative.

item.description: Guardicore's micro-segmentation products will be added to Akamai's portfolio of Zero Trust solutions.

item.description: Transaction marks Plurilockâ€™s second acquisition in 2021.

item.description: New offering can help businesses quickly recover from ransomware attacks, speed data recovery, and advance business continuity.

item.description: A new set of security tools is built to assess risk, provide monitoring and notification if an attack occurs, and train IT pros and users.

item.title: Macs Still Targeted Mostly With Adware, Less With Malware
item.description: The top 10 categories of digital threats on macOS are all adware programs, with only a sliver of the share of victims affected by actual malware, according to an IT management firm.

item.description: $10,000 to be awarded annually for four years each by Optivâ€™s Black Employee Network.

item.description: FiveSys is the second publicly known rootkit since June that attackers have managed to sneak past Microsoft's driver certification process.

item.title: Microsoft, Intel, and Goldman Sachs to Lead New TCG Work Group to Tackle Supply Chain Security Challenges
item.description: Led by representatives from the three companies, the work group will create guidance that defines, implements, and upholds security standards for the entire supply chain.

item.description: Offering to provide transparency into the capabilities of managed security service providers and and managed detection and response competencies.

item.description: Award recipients NPower and CyberWarrior recognized for development of cyber workforce training programs.

item.description: The attackers behind the campaign, which distributes cookie theft malware, are attributed to actors recruited in a Russian-speaking forum.

item.description: It's time to steer the conversation away from whether payment bans should be implemented to how and when they should take effect.

item.description: Obfuscation techniques are extremely prevalent, data shows, but they can't be used as a single indicator of compromise because legitimate websites use them.

item.title: Deepfake Audio Scores $35M in Corporate Heist
item.description: A combination of business email compromise and deepfake audio led a branch manager to transfer millions to scammers, in a case that serves as a warning to organizations.

item.title: Penetration Testing in the Cloud Demands a Different Approach
item.description: Attackers use a different set of techniques to target the cloud, meaning defenders must think differently when pen testing cloud environments.

item.description: LightBasin has displayed in-depth knowledge of telecom architectures and protocols in its attacks, security vendor warns.

item.title: Cato Networks Valued at $2.5B, Raises Additional $200M to Accelerate SASE Adoption Among Large Enterprises
item.description: Cato more than doubles its valuation in one year with largest funding round to date. Total financing reaches $532 million.

item.title: Enterprise Cybersecurity Strategies Are Getting More Attention
item.description: Data in Dark Reading's "2021 Strategic Security Survey" report suggest organizations are taking the security challenge seriously.

item.description: The funding will support product development for Query.AI's browser-based security investigations tool.

item.title: Keysight Technologies Acquires SCALABLE Network Technologies
item.description: Simulation and modeling solutions augment Keysight's 5G and cybersecurity portfolio.

item.title: 2021 State of Ransomware Report Reveals 83% of Victims Paid to Get Data Restored
item.description: Research by ThycoticCentrify shows a majority of organizations experienced a ransomware attack, while 93% are allocating special budget to fight growing threats.
